section.title: Kinetic Energy Practice
section.content:
Kinetic Energy
Practice It’s your turn to put your skills into practice. The questions will get progressively harder, but no matter how small or big the number, the technique is still the same. The equation will be on every page to help you. Complete the questions and fill in the correct answer – you need 4/5 to progress. A calculator is below and remember to answer to 2 decimal places! Kinetic Energy
Practice It’s your turn to put your skills into practice. The questions will get progressively harder, but no matter how small or big the number, the technique is still the same. The equation will be on every page to help you. Complete the questions and fill in the correct answer – you need 4/5 to progress. A calculator is below and remember to answer to 2 decimal places!

section.title: The fastest tennis serve was Samuel Groth at 163.7 mph (73 m/s). The mass of a tennis ball is 58.5 grams (0.0585 kg). Calculate the amount of energy in the tennis balls kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places.
section.content: Answer Correct - Click anywhere or press Control Y to continue Incorrect - Click anywhere or press Control Y to continue You answered this correctly! The mass of a tennis ball is 58.5 grams (0.0585 kg). Calculate the amount of energy in the tennis balls kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places.

section.title: The current record for fastest road car is the Koenigsegg Agera RS and has been clocked at 277.87 mph (128.7 m/s). It weighs in at 1,395 kg. Calculate it’s kinetic energy store at top speed to 2 decimal places!

section.title: You may need a scientific calculator for this one… The Ceres asteroid is the largest object in the asteroid belt. It’s mass is 939,300x1015 kg and it’s travelling at 17.9 km/s. Calculate it’s kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places. (hint: there’s 1,000 metres in 1 km). To make things easier, the answer will be x10^45
section.content:
Answer Correct - Click anywhere or press Control Y to continue Incorrect - Click anywhere or press Control Y to continue You answered this correctly! Your answer: The correct answer is: You did not answer this question completely You must answer the question before continuing Submit Clear You may need a scientific calculator for this one…
The Ceres asteroid is the largest object in the asteroid belt. It’s mass is 939,300x1015 kg and it’s travelling at 17.9 km/s. Calculate it’s kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places. (hint: there’s 1,000 metres in 1 km).
To make things easier, the answer will be x10^45 Answer Correct - Click anywhere or press Control Y to continue Incorrect - Click anywhere or press Control Y to continue You answered this correctly! The Ceres asteroid is the largest object in the asteroid belt. It’s mass is 939,300x1015 kg and it’s travelling at 17.9 km/s. Calculate it’s kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places. (hint: there’s 1,000 metres in 1 km).
To make things easier, the answer will be x10^45
